message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it proposes a new method for color-texture analysis using complex networks. The paper also conducts classification experiments on well-known datasets, which is a common practice in computer vision research. 

The paper may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it introduces new characterization techniques and an automatic and adaptive approach for threshold selection. 

The multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper deals with image analysis and texture characterization. 

The information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category is another possibility as the paper proposes a new method for accessing network dynamic evolution and capturing information regarding within and between color channel spatial interaction. 

Finally, the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category is a possibility as the paper compares the proposed method with deep convolutional neural networks with pre-trained architectures.
